questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting an aging system that reboots randomly, loses its BIOS settings intermittently, and operates very slowly when it boots up. After checking the BIOS battery and finding it at a good voltage, which of the following should the technician check NEXT?

discussion.content: A bad capacitor can cause a variety of mischief in computer circuits. Your computer may spontaneously restart, it may fail to start occasionally or completely.

questions.question_text: As part of a wireless network upgrade, a home user replaced an older 802.11g WAP with one that only works on 802.11ac. Consequently, many network devices can no longer connect. Which of the following is the MOST likely reason?

choices.A: The old devices require a WAP capable of supporting MIMO.
choices.D: 802.11ac only operates on 5GHz, and the user has many 2.4GHz devices.
choices.B: The new WAP is not broadcasting its SSID.
choices.C: The new WAP uses WPA2, which is not compatible with the 802.11g devices.

discussion.content: People 802.11ac only operates in 5ghz I promise. 802.11n is the only network method that operates in 5ghz & 2.4ghz :)

comments.content: Your statement is very correct toastynuke

discussion.content: I think the answer is A, because 802.11g does not support MIMO yet, MIMO came out with 802.11n

Selected Answer: B
Wrong, It's B. 802.11ac supports both 2.4/5 Ghz so this is wrong.

comments.content: you are wrong AshenOne... 802.11ac standard only operates in 5GHz
Agreed. The user hasn't connected to the new WAP with his old devices.

I don't think it is the case, if some devices are able to connect. Seems like the suggested answer, D, is correct since 802.11ac WAPs only operate on 5GHz. Some websites suggest that 802.11ac is backward compatible, but they refer to the devices (like laptops) having compatibility for both ac and older g/n/a, rather than to WAPs.

discussion.content: Keystone correction, colloquially also called keystoning, is a function that allows multimedia projectors that are not placed perpendicular to the horizontal centerline of the screen (too high or too low) to skew the output image, thereby making it rectangular.

questions.question_text: Employees are reporting the image on the screen in a conference room is too wide at the top and too narrow at the bottom. A technician tries to adjust the resolution but is unsuccessful. Which of the following settings should the technician adjust NEXT?

A technician is adding LTE-based connectivity to a laptop. The laptop has the following slots available:
✑ One SoDIMM slot
✑ One SATA III slot
✑ One mini PCIe slot
✑ One microSD card slot
Which of the following should the technician install to complete this task?

choices.A: WWAN card in the mini PCIe slot
choices.B: MicroSDXC card in the microSD slot
choices.C: 802.11ac card in the SATA III slot
choices.D: DDR4 3200 chip in the SoDIMM slot

discussion.content: 802.11 is WLAN, but here you connect with LTE (which is a mobile phone connection)

questions.question_text: A junior technician is working on a new server that will intercept web traffic and file requests from users' computers and retrieve the necessary content. Which of the following is the technician configuring?

discussion.content: A proxy server is a system or router that provides a gateway between users and the internet. Therefore, it helps prevent cyber attackers from entering a private network. It is a server, referred to as an “intermediary” because it goes between end-users and the web pages they visit online.
